title: Broken "Translate page" link
body:
### Long story short:
1. Open a page in 3.28 docs, in a translated language
2. Expand the bottom left menu and cick on "Translate page"
3. At the best, you get in Transifex a page with ALL the strings to translate. It used to bring you to the resources filtered on the page you were reading online (much easier to translate/fix what you saw in published docs)
4. You can also try the "Fix me" link at the bottom of the QGIS main website pages. Same behavior.
5. The link now expects a md5 value of the file path in replacement of page name variable.

SO If you know how to calculate a md5 value of a string in a HTML template file, your help is more than welcome. Or if you have any idea how this Transifex URL works, welcome.

### Do you want the background details and help fix it?

Transifex released months ago its API v3 which brings a lot of changes. We tried to adapt to these  but there is still a painful one: they change the way URL of translated resources are constructed in their application. They used to rely on path to the file (with some formatting)
https://github.com/qgis/QGIS-Documentation/blob/48e18467b4d64bbfaa15d974726bc52f130f8e0e/themes/rtd_qgis/versions.html#L1-L4
Now that same resource should point in Transifex to a URL that ends with  `d446435c2209f557c71db3b1408fa4fe` and there is [no more use of file path](https://community.transifex.com/t/url-of-transifex-editor-pages-shows-file-slug-instead-of-file-name/3346/5)
I found out in a hidden docs that that slug - _as they call it_ - is simply the md5 value of a particular unique path they build based on file path
https://github.com/qgis/QGIS-Documentation/blob/8466e552bdc5cf8f1975cde6bce162968ce62b09/scripts/create_transifex_resources.sh#L41-L48
This works nicely to update [.tx/config](https://github.com/qgis/QGIS-Documentation/blob/e6a19d43c053dc5801b3fb6bb297a81b41a8144c/.tx/config) file and have control on manual pull of translated strings. But I have no idea how to apply the above command in a HTML template file. I looked at JavaScript, jinja2, python but not enough skills to find the correct, lightweigth and less intrusive approach (actually I just didn't find any working syntax).

Or maybe I'm just in a tunnel and there is another way to achieve this...

title: Fix segfault on gdalclosewrapper
body: This is an attempt to fix a few random crashes in the doctests.

title: "Translate page" does not open the right page in Transifex
body:
In the bottom-left menu of 3.10 documentation pages, there's a "Translate page" entry that should help you open the current page in Transifex but it's failing. Indeed:
1. open a page like https://docs.qgis.org/3.10/fr/docs/user_manual/introduction/getting_started.html (replace fr with a language you can translate to)
1. expand the v3.10 menu and press "Translate page"
1. Assuming you are a logged Transifex user, this will open https://www.transifex.com/qgis/qgis-documentation/translate/#fr/docs/user_manual/introduction/getting_started. Not a page you could translate. There still are moves to do in order to reach the right place.
Transifex is actually expecting this url: https://www.transifex.com/qgis/qgis-documentation/translate/#fr/docs--user_manual--introduction--getting_started (replacing in the pagename `/` with `--`)

The url call is made at https://github.com/qgis/QGIS-Documentation/blob/release_3.10/themes/rtd_qgis/versions.html#L43 so if someone knowing scripting with html wants to give it a look, it would be very nice.

Page URL: any

title: [doctest] Segmentation fault (core dumped) make builds fail randomly
body:
Some PRs (https://travis-ci.org/github/qgis/QGIS-Documentation/pull_requests) are failing for the following reason (and this does not happen systematically)
```
Document: docs/user_manual/auth_system/auth_workflows
-----------------------------------------------------
Makefile:43: recipe for target 'doctest' failed
make: *** [doctest] Segmentation fault (core dumped)
docker.mk:4: recipe for target 'doctest' failed
make: *** [doctest] Error 2
The command "make -f docker.mk doctest" exited with 2.
cache.2
store build cache
```
Anyone knows what the issue could be?

title: Building PDF with "make pdf" command is broken
body:
Trying to build the pdf version of docs with `make pdf` systematically fails while the docker route (which as far as i understand relies on the same makefile) succeeds. The failure occurs when trying to copy the generated file to the final folder. Here's the output (the docker outputs same msg except the mv failure) 
```
# Compile the pdf docs for that locale
# we use texi2pdf since latexpdf target is not available via
# sphinx-build which we need to use since we need to pass language flag
mkdir -p output/pdf/en
# need to build 3x to have proper toc and index
# currently texi2pdf has bad exit status. Please ignore errors!!
# prepending the texi2pdf command with - keeps make going instead of quitting
# japanese pdf has problems, when build with texi2pdf
# as alternative we can use platex
# for russian pdf you need package 'texlive-lang-cyrillic' installed
# for japanese pdf you need: 'cmap-adobe-japan1 cmap-adobe-japan2 latex-cjk-all nkf okumura-clsfiles ptex-base ptex-bin texlive-fonts-extra'
/usr/bin/texi2dvi: pdflatex exited with bad status, quitting.
/usr/bin/texi2dvi: pdflatex exited with bad status, quitting.
/usr/bin/texi2dvi: pdflatex exited with bad status, quitting.
Makefile:79: recipe for target 'pdf' failed
make: [pdf] Error 1 (ignorée)
mv output/latex/en/QGISUserGuide.pdf output/pdf/en/QGIS-testing-UserGuide.pdf
mv: cannot stat 'output/latex/en/QGISUserGuide.pdf': No such file or directory
Makefile:79: recipe for target 'pdf' failed
make: *** [pdf] Error 1
```

title: Improvements to PyQGIS cookbook - Map Rendering and Printing
body:
## Description

Improvements to the Map Rendering and Printing Section of the PyQGIS Cookbook based on some comments from @nyalldawson in here
https://github.com/qgis/QGIS-Documentation/pull/3974#issuecomment-509852898

- layout.initializeDefaults() # this initializes the layout with some default settings, specifically by adding an empty A4 page to the layout. You can create layouts without calling this method, but you'll need to take care of adding pages to the layout yourself
- "this item tells the libraries where to put the map itself. Here we create a map and stretch it over the whole paper size" - the code doesn't do the stretch part. I think it'll create a 0 width/0 height item by default!. You probably want something like map.attemptMove(QgsLayoutPoint(0,0, QgsUnitTypes.LayoutMillimeters)) and map.attemptResize(QgsLayoutSize(200,200, QgsUnitTypes.LayoutMillimeters)). Note that these methods are called "attempt..." because certain layout or item settings (e.g. data defined position or size) will override the call - so you are asking nicely, but aren't necessarily guaranteed that the item WILL move or resize to what you've asked!
-  layout.addItem( ... ) - this should be layout.addLayoutItem( ... )

We try to keep the overhead as small as possible and appreciate if you help us to do so by completing the following items.
Include sentences with details describing the issue you have encountered (e.g., actual behavior, expected behavior, steps to reproduce).
-->
Page URL:

https://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/pyqgis_developer_cookbook/composer.html#map-rendering-and-printing

title: Isolate expressions tests in a group
body:
to avoid them changing results in other chapters.

This should fix the failures that from time to time occurred in the build. 
I won't insist anymore on this but we should decide whether we want to use the testing framework, hence make it mandatory for all codes (meaning that instructions and how-to are available, clear and explicit for everyone, we cover all the requirements of QGIS) or continue with old `.. code-block`, with unfortunately the limits it has but it'll spare build failure tracking time for some.
My choice would go for 1 but it's not an area I'm comfortable with...

<!---
If your PR fixes a ticket, add `fix` in front of the ticket number. The ticket will be closed automatically.
Add as much as needed `fix #number` if the PR closes more than one ticket.
If your PR doesn't fix entirely the ticket, just add the ticket reference.
The complete list of the issues is at https://github.com/qgis/QGIS-Documentation/issues.
-->
Ticket: #

<!---
Indicate whether the fix should be backported to previous release.
Replace the space between square brackets by a `x` to make it checked.
-->
- [x] Backport to LTR documentation is required

### Minimal requirements for merging *(for maintainers)*

Reviewing is a process done by community members, mostly on a volunteer basis.
We try to keep the overhead as small as possible and appreciate if you help us.
In order for your PR to get merged it should satisfy some minimal requirements:
--->

--->

title: Unexpected removal of references when updating substitutions list with the automatic script
body: When executing the `./scripts/find_set_subst.py` script, it happens that references to some substitutions (`|plugin-new|` and `|plugin-upgrade|`) in the `source/docs/pyqgis_developer_cookbook/plugins.rst` are removed despite they are being used in the file.

title: Issues with images preview in GitHub
body:
Reporting some issues with the new and really nice :heart: image preview infrastructure:
- [x] When you change a file in GitHub (not sure it happens when working locally), committing often (always?) add "changes" at the end of the file  (different EOF?)
- [ ] running the python script _find_set_subst_ to update the list of substitutions (when a substitution is renamed/added/removed):
  * adds an empty line above the "substitution list section" each time it's run
  * the empty line is added to ALL the rst files of the docs --> requires a manual check to find the right files to clean and commit in the branch.  (this one is a bit annoying)

Thanks.
@SrNetoChan ? @rduivenvoorde ?

title: Search doesn't work in Testing documentation
body:
## Description
Let's do a search in the QGIS Doc search bar, using "Offline" word.
In 2.18: the link is http://docs.qgis.org/2.18/en/search.html?q=offline&check_keywords=yes&area=default which returns a result
In Testing: the link is http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/search.html?q=offline&check_keywords=yes&area=default endlessly searches --> No result is returned

This had been reported in irc few weeks ago but not here... And still present!

@rduivenvoorde any idea?

title: Using a double slash in a page link breaks its formatting

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: Issue or PR without any activity for a moment

body:
With the new generic help system landed in master, users can reach online documentation from within the application. Thanks to @alexbruy and the others.
If instead of http://docs.qgis.org/2.14/en/docs/user_manual, the users write http://docs.qgis.org/2.14/en/docs/user_manual/ (note the slash at the end) for the documentation path to use, the hyperlink created when hitting the help button is like http://docs.qgis.org/2.14/en/docs/user_manual//introduction/qgis_configuration.html#options which returns a kind of plain text of the real page (no images rendered e.g.). 
This was reported at http://hub.qgis.org/issues/16156 but @alexbruy suggested me to also report it at the server side in order to have double slash behaviour tackled there as well (given that this can occur while typing the link in the browser too). Here it's.

@rduivenvoorde ?

title: Loss of translation in 2.8 docs?
body:
AFAIR, QGIS 2.8 doc has been fully translated into French: Transifex has for months shown 100% completed.
Browsing the doc now, I'm surprised to see a lot of untranslated texts, texts which were already translated in previous versions and are kept translated in 2.14. Examples:
**2.6**: http://docs.qgis.org/2.6/fr/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/editing_geometry_attributes.html (fully translated)
**2.8**: http://docs.qgis.org/2.8/fr/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/editing_geometry_attributes.html (only titles seem translated)
**2.14**: http://docs.qgis.org/2.14/fr/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/editing_geometry_attributes.html (this chapter has been deeply reviewed but a lot of translation are still available)
I think it's the same thing for other languages.

While 2.8 is no longer the LTR, it's always used by people and, as a fully (french) translated doc, we still use this doc to indicate items to users. Imho, we should not lose those translations (if still retrievable).

title: Node tool - Shift does not seem to toogle vertex selection
body: In http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/editing_geometry_attributes.html#basic-operations is stated that you can hold Ctrl or Shif to toogle the node's selection. According to my tests, only Ctrl work that way.

title: Chapter loaded but not visible in the index
body:
Hi..
in the past days I've added 2 R chapter in the training manual and they have been merged into the master branch.. 

The chapter have been added in the Training Manual index and they are loaded in the server:

http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/training_manual/processing/r_syntax.html
http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/training_manual/processing/r_syntax-table.html

but they are not visible in the main index..

http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/training_manual/processing/index.html

is this a normal behavior or something is missing? 

Thanks

title: Tables are truncated and unreadable in the PDF version
body: In the PDF version of the user manual many tables in the Expression Chapter are wrongly rendered ( table truncated at the end of page, column truncated, mixed texts of different columns..) Just unusable I'm afraid.

title: Ro language pdf's have empty spaces where special characters should be
body:
I tried on a local build and the pdf's run ok but the output pdf's from http://docs.qgis.org/2.8/pdf/ro are bad.

Where-from are the pdf generated?

title: Remove local content TOC from the PDF manuals
body: Adding a TOC at the top of long pages in the documentation surely improves  the navigation. But these TOCs are also added in the PDF version of the doc, disturbing chapter's reading and increasing uselessly the number of pages.

title: Icons and substitutions are wrongly placed inside tip or note insert
body:
In any tip or note insert where an icon is used, it's always placed at the beginning of the line instead of near the related command. Examples:
- above http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/editing_geometry_attributes.html#zoom-to-feature
- http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/editing_geometry_attributes.html#node-tool
- above http://docs.qgis.org/testing/en/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/vector_properties.html#rule-based-rendering
- ...

title: documentation not included in build
body:
There is some documentation written that is not included in the build of the documentation and therefore generates warnings. 

We have to decide to either include or remove (delete) this documentation.
I think the python documentation for example should be removed. It is an unfinished start and it is there for a while.

Documentation not included:
-training_manual/processing/geomorpho.rst
-training_manual/processing/r_intro.rst
-training_manual/python/index.rst
-training_manual/python/overview.rst
-user_manual/plugins/plugins_sql_anywhere.rst
-user_manual/processing_algs/qgis/vector_table_tools/refactorfields.rst

title: Wrong dbname in port description for Oracle connection
body:
URL: http://docs.qgis.org/2.6/en/docs/user_manual/working_with_vector/supported_data.html#id1
Section: Creating a stored Connection

`Port: Port number the PostgreSQL database server listens on. The default port is 1521.`

Should be:

`Port: Port number of the Oracle database server listens on. The default port is 1521.`
